-e ---

𐌳 dđt < 𓅂

While often 𐍄 is more like D in german readings (Hebrew ד)
Conversely 𐌳 is more like T in german readings (Hebrew טצ)

𐌳 and 𐌸 appear to be very similar:
𐌲𐍉𐌳𐍃 guds gōds gut, good, gütig
𐌲𐍉𐌸𐍃 guƌs gōƌs gut, good, gütig

𐍆𐌰𐌳𐌰𐍂 father Vater pater •Pfađter

Funnyly the roles are swapped in english readings (in those cases where both readings are part of the modern vocabulary)

𐌳𐌰𐌻 Tal (Delle vs tall tell) valley,ditch
𐌳𐌰𐌹𐌻𐍃 Teil… part,portion,share (abdail in Hebrew though)
𐌳𐌰𐌲𐍃 dags Tage…, days day
𐌳𐌰𐌲𐌰𐌽𐌳𐍃 dagands Tagungs… day…
𐍅𐌰𐌿𐍂𐌳 waurd Wort word
𐍅𐌰𐌹𐌻𐌰𐌳𐌴𐌸𐍃 weιladeƌs WohlTaten / well.deeds

𐌳 rarely biphonal δ (demi/semi/sdemi?) :

𐌳𐌹𐍅𐌰𐌽⋍die…
𐌳𐌹𐍅𐌰𐌽⋍sterven starven < sterben
